attributes.action: Keep the A422 through Farthinghoe closed and build a sensible bypass instead.
attributes.background: The recent road closure at Farthinghoe provides the occasion to finally address the problem of heavy traffic passing dangerously through this lovely village.
attributes.additional_details:
Farthinghoe has been in need of a bypass for more than 20 years but the funds and political will have not been available.

Last year there was a consultation and a route chosen.

It isn't sensible to spend money re-opening a road which isn't fit for purpose. Public funds should be spent instead on creating a safe and sustainable solution in the form of a bypass.

The road passes within feet of Farthinghoe village primary school and the children are much safer thanks to the closure.

attributes.action: Establish sepsis as a medical emergency and a priority for the NHS
attributes.background:
The recent surge of sepsis related deaths in the UK, including of my own grandmother, needs to be addressed before more people are lost unnecessarily to the infection. 

Many are dying from sepsis but of these only around 40% of death certificates state sepsis as cause of death.
attributes.additional_details:
Sepsis kills more than 44,000 people a year in the UK alone. This is more than breast, bowel and prostate cancer combined.

Despite these alarming statistics many don’t know about the implications and seriousness of the infection, which leads to an increase in blood pressure and multiple organ failure.

The amount of people with sepsis has increased by over a third from 2015 to 2017, showing this is an ever increasing problem which needs to be addressed as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Each child receiving high rate DLA should have a ECHP when they turn 3
attributes.background: I thought my son would go to mainstream school, I was wrong. If the EHCP was a procedure that was required to happen, he would not be without a school. Most high rate DLA children cannot cope in a mainstream school. This needs to be in place to give parents the options that’s right for their child.
attributes.additional_details: I have waited 31 weeks and still have no place as I was not given enough guidance. This is a process most will only go through once. Let’s make it easier to get a child into the right school. Inclusion, not exclusion. No mainstream school could cater for my son. Many children are placed in the wrong provisions to make the numbers match. It’s time this changed and this process is looked at.

attributes.action: Criminalise chatting to children online even if the chat isn't sexual.
attributes.background: We believe it should be an offence (when the child and adult do not know each other "offline" - in real life) to chat to a child under the age of 16 online, whether actual sexual grooming takes place or not.
attributes.additional_details: Children can still be manipulated into meeting with an adult whose true intentions to sexually abuse the victim are never revealed in chat. Indeed cases just like this do happen when nothing remotely sexual has been discussed in chat yet the intention to facilitate the meet is still the aim by the predator who has then gone on to abuse the child.

attributes.action: PM to honour promise: BREXIT negotiated by Sen. Sec. of State who voted leave
attributes.background: The Prime Minister, by announcing that she will lead negotiations with the EU, while DExEU will only prepare, has broken her promise and lost the trust of the voting public and a significant part of her party and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: In June 2016, Theresa May promised that, "Brexit means Brexit". In the same speech, she promised, "I will therefore create a new government department responsible for conducting Britain’s negotiation with the EU and for supporting the rest of Whitehall in its European work. That department will be lead by a senior secretary of state and I will make sure that the position is taken by a Member of Parliament who campaigned for Britain to leave the EU."

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: Offer a catchup HPV vaccine programme to women aged 18-26 on the NHS
attributes.background:
- Many women missed the HPV vaccine while at school due to parental abstention or missed appointments.
- The HPV vaccine is currently only available to women on the NHS up until age 18
- The vaccine retails at £450 at high-street pharmacies - utterly unaffordable for most.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS vaccine guidelines - https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/vaccinations/hpv-human-papillomavirus-vaccine/

3100 cases of cervical cancer are diagnosed in the UK each year - almost ALL are related to HPV - https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cervical-cancer

It's utterly unacceptable that girls and women who were opted out by their parents while at school are unable to catch up when they hit the age of medical consent. Providing the vaccine as a catchup will save lives, and save NHS money.

attributes.action: Strip First Group and MTR of their South Western Railway Franchise.
attributes.background: Since taking over the Franchise from Stagecoach, the service that customers have had to put up with has been disgraceful. High prices, poor service, constant delays and without any punishment from the Government. Time it stops!

attributes.action: Lower the Voting age to 16
attributes.background:
At 16, UK citizens can do the following:
Get married with consent
Can own property
Can get a job
Can join the army
Pay taxes
Join a trade union
Many 16 year-olds feel that as they contribute to society and the country, they deserve their voices heard as to its political direction and leader.

attributes.action: More Necessary Research and Funding on the NHS for Ehlers Danlos Patients.
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos syndrome is a condition that affects the connective tissue. Several of the symptoms involve stretchy skin, severe dislocations and unusual bleeding as well as joint pain. Seven years ago I was diagnosed with Eds which is when I realised that research was limited.
attributes.additional_details: As an EDS sufferer for several years, it has become apparent that the lack of research and funding and treatments not being on the NHS is the reason that Ehlers danlos patients are treated unfairly. If we attend Accident and Emergency we should not have to explain to medical professionals what our condition is and the symptoms they should look out for and we should not have to find our own ways of treatment because the NHS lacks sufficient help.

attributes.action: Ban snares because animals suffer terrible injuries and deaths
attributes.background: Snares are compared to landmines for the indiscriminate way in which these wire traps capture a wide range of animals – from foxes to family pets to protected species. A snare is an archaic thin metal wire noose intended to catch animals by lassoing and trapping them.
attributes.additional_details:
Snares are mainly set on shooting estates to stop foxes from catching the 'game' birds. Britain is one of the few European countries where so-called free-running snares are still used and most countries have banned them. 
The Government believes that snare use can be controlled by a Code of Practice - but this is impossibly to enforce! 
One council has banned snares to protect British wildlife - https://www.league.org.uk/news/council-bans-snares-to-protect-british-wildlife.

attributes.action: Amend s.76 Serious Crime Act 2015 (Parental Alienation amendment)
attributes.background: Parental Alienation is a psychological crime against former partners and children, yet is largely ignored by the Police and Courts. Amend s.76 SCA 2015 to specifically make Parental Alienation a "domestic Abuse" crime. This is child abuse as well as parent abuse and it must stop.
attributes.additional_details: The Courts, CAFCASS, Social Services and the Police treat domestic violence as a crime against women, yet up to 1200 men take their lives each year because the system blocks them from their children. Whilst this may seem like a crime against an adult, it is actually child abuse. Reports in numerous countries demonstrate how damaging this is to children and yet the UK Government ignores the issue. One suicide is too many, but over 1000 annually is a national disgrace.

attributes.action: Ban all new fossil fuel vehicles by 2030
attributes.background: The UK Government has committed to banning new diesel and petrol cars by 2040. This is too late. The Clean Growth Strategy and legally binding carbon budgets require policies & action on major emitters and transport is now the largest contributing sector to UK emissions and causes air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/mar/18/uk-should-bring-2040-petrol-and-diesel-car-ban-forward-2030-green-alliance

https://www.theccc.org.uk/2018/01/17/uks-ambitious-clean-growth-strategy-must-translated-urgently-action/

http://www.green-alliance.org.uk/resources/How_the_UK_can_lead_the_electric_vehicle_revolution.pdf

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-40723581

attributes.action: Give the electorate a Referendum to make House of Lords wholly elected via PR
attributes.background: The House of Lords membership criteria belongs to previous centuries, the UK  electorate deserves a wholly elected 2nd Chamber. Elected using solely proportional representation as a method of checks & balances.

attributes.action: The UK government should allow Steve Bannon to enter the UK
attributes.background: Steve Bannon is not a far-right political figure he is just plain and simple Right.  To say he poses a risk to the security of the UK is absurd. He should be allowed to enter the UK and give a strong alternative view to the liberal left we have here.

attributes.action: Make Mobility allowance available from birth on need, remove age discrimination.
attributes.background: Mobility allowance is only available to people over the age of 3, over  two thousand children under the age of 3 are required to have bulky medical equipment or specialised support wheelchairs, and as such are at risk when travelling in unsuitable or potentially unsafe vehicles  for their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The government wants children under three to go to a charity to get funding for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle, this is discriminating against them on the grounds of age, and goes against the governments own policy published on 1 October 2012 that outlaws discrimination based on age, the requirement for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle should be base wholly on the need of the child and age should not be a qualifying factor, these children can effectively become housebound because of this policy.

attributes.action: A pre-biopsy MRI prostate assessment should be offered all men with elevated PSA
attributes.background: A pre-biopsy MRI assessment with contrast agent can detect prostate cancer not detected by the PSA test. All men with symptoms consistent with prostate cancer should be offered an MRI assessment within four weeks by their GP. This will aid early diagnosis improving patient outcome.
attributes.additional_details:
Practical Barriers to Obtaining Pre-Biopsy Prostate MRI: Assessment in over 1,500 Consecutive Men Undergoing Prostate Biopsy in a Single Urologic Practice 
A.B. Rosenkrantz 
ISSN: 0042-1138 , 1423-0399; DOI: 10.1159/000446003 
Urologia internationalis. , 2016, Vol.97(2), p.247-248

Prostate MRI Can Reduce Overdiagnosis and Overtreatment of Prostate Cancer 
A.B. Rosenkrantz 
ISSN: 1076-6332; DOI: 10.1016/j.acra.2015.02.006 
Academic Radiology , 2015, Vol.22(8), p.1000-1006

attributes.action: Parliament to debate withdrawal of British support for Iran Nuclear deal.
attributes.background: On May 1st, BBC reported US response to Israel's claim of secret Iranian nuclear weapons factory hidden in Northern Syria, with the goal of producing 5 nuclear warheads. Israel presented evidence to show that Iran lied and defrauded the deal. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-43958205
attributes.additional_details: The Iran deal has produced great international controversy since its signature in 2015. To many, the very idea of bribing a terrorist-supporting state not to produce nuclear weapons has always been a dangerous nonsense. The British government talked a big talk against Russia with the Skripal poisoning, but seems completely blind to Iran's recklessly dangerous actions. This double standard needs be justified with full public parliamentary debate about withdrawing from the Iran deal.

attributes.action: Guarantee the right to remain in the UK of all Afghan interpreters
attributes.background: Afghan interpreters who served with the UK Armed Forces on Op HERRICK are currently at risk of deportation from the UK. If sent to Afghanistan they will likely be killed by the Taliban. We ask the Govt to grant Afghan interpreters and their families citizenship and the right to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/afghan-interpreters-fear-being-sent-home-to-their-fate-under-visa-rules-0d7qdn8vr
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-43904806
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/6198982/afghan-interpreters-uk-eviction-home-office-2400/

attributes.action: Make DLA/ PIP assessment companies liable for wrongly rejected claims
attributes.background: Countless disabled and individuals severely in need are not being awarded what they are rightly entitled to. Furthermore, those already in recipient of DLA/PIP are having their awards completely taken away. Companies must be fined when appeals succeed to make them assess claims properly.
attributes.additional_details: Daily, there are numerous reports of wrongly rejected claims. These awards are often taken away or not awarded at all because PIP assessment companies don’t take their responsibilities seriously. Reports are showing consistent similarities - What a claimant has said and what a medical professional who knows them personally, is not being taken into account. In addition to this, assessors are writing claimants have shown examples of doing things that contradicts the truth entirely.

attributes.action: Require free water bottle refilling stations across UK service stations
attributes.background: The price of bottled water is extortionate in service stations across the UK (in some places beer is cheaper). This means people are penalised for needing an essential fuel of life, and adds to the plastic waste issue epidemic.
attributes.additional_details: Water bottle refilling stations would help cut down our plastic waste, promote a healthier lifestyle, and cut out the unnecessarily high price for bottled water in service stations, all at a low cost to the tax payer. This could be paired with cardboard cups and recycling bins for those wishing to have a quick drink on the go.

attributes.action: Save the NHS with a 1p in the pound increase in income tax/national insurance.
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis. Funding, although somewhat increased, has been outstripped by a need for additional services. With a 1p rise we could gain approx 11bn funding. We are lucky to get healthcare free at point of use. The equivalent private or insurance cost would exceed the tax increase
attributes.additional_details: https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/politics/gordon-brown-says-1p-tax-12647021

attributes.action: Reinstate the annual Royal Tournament
attributes.background:
The Royal Tournament was the world's largest military tattoo and pageant, held by the British Armed Forces annually between 1880 and 1999.
A celebration of the British Armed Forces, and promoting the UK globally, it is the ideal annual event to promote support for the British Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Tournament provides many benefits to the UK, showcasing the UK military as well as in terms of services charitable awareness, retention of personnel and as a much needed recruitment tool for our armed services.

attributes.action: Condemn Israeli Army killings of 30 unarmed Palestinian protestors in Gaza
attributes.background: On Friday 30th March this year Palestinians living in the Gaza Strip gathered at various points along the border with Israel to peacefully protest the blockade and demand their right of return to homes that they had been driven out of in 1948 during the Nakba. Now 30 are dead and 1000+ injured.
attributes.additional_details: The 1948 Palestinian exodus, also known as the Nakba, literally "disaster", "catastrophe", or "cataclysm"), occurred when more than 700,000 Palestinian Arabs fled or were expelled from their homes, during the 1948 Palestine war. Between 400 and 600 Palestinian villages were sacked during the war, while urban Palestine was almost entirely extinguished. The term "nakba" also refers to the period of war itself and events affecting Palestinians from December 1947 to January 1949

attributes.action: Require and fund access for disabled witnesses in all courts.
attributes.background: Disabled people should have access to all courts in the UK which should comply with The Equality Act 2010. Courts have a duty to make these adjustments ,removing barriers restricting the access that prevents people with disabilities being able to attend court, however this isn’t always the case.
attributes.additional_details:
People with disabilities have the same rights as able bodied people, and should receive the same level of service. If these measures are not put in place, this should be known as unlawful discrimination. This prevents people with disabilities from continuing with the criminal justice system. This should be implemented for both the witness and the defendant. 
Ramp access through the entire court should be standard. 
I could not access the witness door because it had a step, this led me to, “bump” into my abuser. I had to sit very close to him with a screen but could still hear his breath as I was answering questions.

attributes.action: Make the DVLA Vehicle Records and HPI records available to the public for FREE
attributes.background:
Fight for the freedom of information and the abuse by the current system forcing people to pay £20 to check a car for its records! 
All information should be free to the public including the details of the registered keepers. In many scenarios this free information could avoid a lot of difficulties
attributes.additional_details: It is unbelievable that the publics rights to freedom of information is In 2018 still being violated by the DVLA and car keeper details are still withheld from the public and kept secret only to be sold to third party companies [clamping and parking firms] (for £2.50 each check) it is absurd that these details should be held private and it shouldnt be any different than The Land Register that is available to the public. I don’t think I need to explain why all the HPI records should be free.

attributes.action: Urge USA not to cease funding UNWRA and contribute towards any shortfall
attributes.background:
The US decision further destabilises the Middle East and make the possibility of a peaceful solution more remote. It shows further partiality in favour of Israel following  moving its embassy to Jerusalem and increasing aid to Israel

UK should urge other countries to help making up the shortfall
attributes.additional_details:
UNWRA provides food aid and education to Palestinian refugees and this loss of funding will cause immense suffering and misery.
https://www.unrwa.org
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-45377336

attributes.action: Stop NHS patients being weighed in public waiting rooms and corridors.
attributes.background: In NHS hospital departments, patients are weighed in a public waiting rooms within sight and earshot of other patients and visitors. The NHS must provide dignity for patients.
attributes.additional_details: This is humiliating for patients, especially those who may have experienced weight difficulties, insecurities around body image, mental health issues etc.

attributes.action: Reconsider the changes made to A-levels in respect to the amount of content.
attributes.background: New A-level changes have too much information content that needs to be taught, This is contributing to a student mental health crisis and is not allowing teacher to focus on development of expression, analysis and evaluation, essential skills required for student's future endeavours.

attributes.action: To strip of Govia of its franchises (Southern,Thameslink,Gt Northern & GX)
attributes.background: Following years of poor services across the Southern Railway, Thameslink, Gatwick Express & Gt. Northern rail network we call upon Parliament & DfT to consider the return of these services to public sector operation as done with the East Coast Line which has proven financial record in public hands
attributes.additional_details: The reliability of the service provided by Govia has been steadily deteriorating for years & now with the latest timetable shake up has seen journey times extended, more connections, mass train delays & cancellations. When the ECL was last in public ownership it generated money (£1b) for reinvestment services something that could help Govia passengers get the service they deserve. https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/nov/27/privatising-east-coast-rail-rip-off?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

attributes.action: Recruit at least 20,000 more police officers.
attributes.background: There is a national crises. Volumes of emergencies have increased rapidly in the last 5 years. Speed is the key to solving crimes and there is the "golden hour" which is often missed causing loss of evidence resulting in not finding perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Figures obtained from the BBC Police under pressure programme on 16th May 2018. Police themselves are under threat from organised gangs who are aware of police limitations.  There have been 23,000 assaults on officers in 2014/15 alone. Not all assaults get reported. The rate of physical assault against police officers being almost 12 times the "all occupations" rate. Cracks are now beginning to show, increasing amounts of risk to public safety because there are less and less officers and staff.

attributes.action: Enact an Environmental Law
attributes.background: Since the BBC 1 broadcasting of the Blue Planet (Oceans) showing the harm caused to marine life by plastic packaging there has been a public outcry.
attributes.additional_details:
Supermarket chains should be compelled (by law) to publish on their web sites their use of three categories of plastic packaging.

1) Single Use Plastic 
2) Recyclable Plastic 
3) 100% biodegradable plastic 

And all as a percentage of their total plastic packaging. - Doing this would enable consumers to make choices as to where they shop, and what purchases they make not just on price but additionally and importantly on environmental sustainability.

attributes.action: Constitution to prevent ceding sovereignty to foreign powers without referendum
attributes.background:
In signing the European Communities Bill in 1972 thus taking us into the EEC without our consent, Edward Heath sacrificed our independence. Thus making the articles on the supremacy of British Parliament only of historical perspective.
He should've had referendum 1st on such constitutional change
attributes.additional_details:
In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change. 
We need a constitution that is not merely convention, but that is actually written into our law to prevent this happening again.

attributes.action: Compulsory compensation by local authorities.
attributes.background: Following the introduction of the ULEZ coming into action in April 2019, millions of Londoners are being deprived of their valued possessions by the decision of the local authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Any implementation of new / change of regulation, imposed by any authority in the UK triggering the immediate devaluation of personal possessions of its constituents (e.g. the immediate depreciation of personal and commercial vehicles following the introduction of ULEZ) should be bound by law to a compulsory compensatory pay equal to the true and actual loss suffered to every individual or entity affected and deprived of the financial value of its possessions in the public interest.

attributes.action: Update the current legislation: "The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989"
attributes.background: There exists ambiguity within the electrical industry, specifically with regard to electrical installation of equipment, with what can be considered acceptable with regard to meeting the requirements of regulations, due to the outdated and generic criteria which is open to interpretation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EaWR 1989 would benefit from an update to specifically clarify and reference the associated standards and regulations detailed below:

The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989

The Electrical Equipment (Safety) Regulations 2016

BS 7671

BS 6423

This would ensure that persons on whom duties are imposed (e.g. duty holders) have a clear and defined defence against any alleged breaches.

attributes.action: Put gynaecological health on the PSHE curriculum for girls aged 11-18
attributes.background: Endometriosis and polycystic ovary syndrome affect millions of girls and women nationwide but there is not any explanation to young women about the symptoms of such illnesses. Education on gynaecological health needs to be put on the curriculum so less women go through their young life in pain.

attributes.action: Change vaping law to hold more than 2 ml of liquid in any device
attributes.background: Vapes were made to hold only 2ml of juice making people carry bottles with them all the time. You carry bottles around with you, it’s stupid and makes no sense.

attributes.action: Issue British passports without the EU logo.
attributes.background: As the British people voted to leave the EU on 23 June 2016 and will be entirely out by March 2019, stop issuing British passports with the EU logo immediately and give people the option to exchange a passport with an EU logo for one without an EU logo, for a small fee.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all schools to display their Anti Bullying Policy!
attributes.background:
A recent study has seen that 80% of teens were not aware their school had an anti-bullying policy. 
100% said they felt it would benefit if the policy was displayed on notice boards around the school. So let’s make it the law to have it displayed and not just on a website!!
attributes.additional_details:
This study was conducted on Chat2HelpAllTeenagers.co.uk from 30 teenagers across the UK. 
Why aren’t schools making all parents and children aware of the policy - as the government website indicates all parents and children should be told about it. 
This recent study highlights that this is not done, and feel we need to change this! 
 
So please help, sign this petition 
 
www.chat2helpallteenagers.co.uk

attributes.action: To increase the speed limit on UK motorways to 85 miles per hour.
attributes.background: Many of us drive at around 80 miles per hour on the motorway. It is common to be overtaken by vehicles travelling at much higher speeds. It appears we are all breaking the law: yet only a few of us are caught over-speeding, prosecuted, fined and criminalized; this undermines the law.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics indicated that almost 50% of vehicles exceeded the speed limit in 2011 on the motorways. Modern vehicles with superior braking systems and a whole raft of safety systems can travel at much higher speeds comfortably. The European Transport Safety Council found that most vehicle accidents in 27 European countries occur on rural and urban roads: not on Motorways. The low UK speed limit on motorways may be responsible for congestion by preventing ‘free flow’ of traffic.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling at people’s homes
attributes.background: A neighbour was brutally attacked and murdered in her own home after answering the door to her assailant. It’s common knowledge that conmen use cold calling to steal from vulnerable people and gain access to homes often leading to devastating consequences.
attributes.additional_details: People should not be allowed to sell goods or services door-to-door without an invitation. We need to ban cold calling to protect the elderly and vulnerable by cutting off access for the cruel people that use this as a means of access. Most people now will go online to source builders, windows etc and look for reviews of companies. We do not need people knocking on our homes leaving some scared and open to being subjecting to robberies, fraud and being harmed.

attributes.action: Send out a booklet to every household in the UK about leaving the EU
attributes.background: The government spent £9 million of taxpayers money informing the public they wanted to remain in the EU and why. The people rejected the governments view and gave an instruction to leave the EU  . The government must now spend an equal amount on a Brexit booklet explaining the advantages of Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The public are being bombarded with scaremongering from the media and politicians of the damage Brexit will cause to our country.
It is time for the government to provide a booklet promoting the positives of being an independent nation again and set out its vision of the future for our trade, workers and civil rights, security and the revival of our fishing fleets. 

The government must act fairly and provide a Brexit booklet on the advantages of leaving the single market and customs union

attributes.action: Build animal bridges over country roads to stop them being killed in the 1000's
attributes.background: Living in the countryside it breaks my heart to see dead birds, deer, foxes, rabbits and badgers dead on the road. Animals just trying to live in a world that we have added thousands of cars to. They are being punished by humans. We already rule the world. Save the wildlife while there's time
attributes.additional_details: A65 is a prime example of this in Cumbria. Every single day there is a dead animal on this road. And most other roads around these parts. It's disgusting how we destroy every we touch let alone what we are doing to the animals. Finding a half dead mangled deer at the side of the road and having to put it out of its misery is the worst thing I've had to do and it's not the first one. Please get on board

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Dental Hygiene in pregnancy’ booklets to 12 week antenatal checkups
attributes.background:
I feel like we are being let down in terms of proactive dental hygiene education for pregnant women.
 I believe thousands of women are having to undergo dental work postpartum as they were not aware of the significant affect that changes in hormones during pregnancy can have on their teeth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am aware that the NHS provides free dental care to pregnant women & for up to one year post partum but I feel that more should be done proactively in order to stop new mums having to go through painful/intrusive dental treatment. 

Advice regarding additional brushing after certain foods, not brushing immediately after bouts of morning sickness, additional visits to the hygienist, increasing calcium & vitamin D 

Ensuring that both midwives & dentists educate pregnant women of additional risks

attributes.action: Referendum to join the EU on the 30th of March 2019
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU on the 29th of March 2019. There will be no second referendum for leaving the EU. The applicant accepts this.

However, the applicant strongly believes that there should be a referendum for joining the EU again on the 30th of March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2016 referendum was overshadowed by misinformation from both sides, scaremongering and possibly foreign interference. 

The voters did not fully understand what the EU is or the impact on their lives and the UK as a whole. 

This petition is no attempt to change the fact that the UK is leaving the EU.

However, and in the name of democracy, the voters should enjoy a referendum to decide if the UK should join the EU again after the 29th of March 2019.

For Queen & Country,

attributes.action: Revoke the Amendment to the Double Taxation Agreement (Article 18)  March 2018.
attributes.background:
We were in the Royal Air Force for just under 30 years.  We had met and holidayed in Cyprus towards the latter part of our service.
We decided that we would like to remain in Cyprus after our years were up.
The amended DTA would reduce the amount of household income Veterans' have to live on.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed amendment to the DTA, signed by both Governments in March 2018 (and yet to be passed by either parliament), proposes that from next year, Civil Service and Military Pensions will be taxed at source (the U.K.) and not as the majority of us arranged, when we decided to live and contribute here in Cyprus.

All we ask is that we can continue to live and contribute here with the same agreements in place from 1960, and even with Cyprus joining the E.U. in 2004.

attributes.action: To prohibit the sale of rat poison to non-professionals
attributes.background: People are baiting dog treats and or leaving large quantities of it in parks and open spaces to kill off animals. I have had one dog recently die and another even more recently digest a large quantity and is lucky to be alive. Luckily we rushed him straight to the vets and he is now home safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theargus.co.uk/news/16860293.family-devastated-as-rat-poison-kills-one-dog-and-almost-kills-another/

attributes.action: Government: honour your manifesto pledge to plant 11m trees by 2020
attributes.background: You won the election with a promise to plant 11million trees by 2020. You must action this and report bi-annually on progress with measures in place to ensure this is met.
attributes.additional_details: Governments must honour their manifesto pledges. Climate change is upon us and biodiversity loss is unprecedented. This government must be held to account on environmental protection & lack of tangible action on their tree planting pledge. Trees take years to grow, they need a management plan and funds to support their maturation. The Government should deliver their promise on time or provide funding to ensure that a suitable charity can take ownership of this action.

attributes.action: Provide domestic violence victims with paid leave to help them escape abusers
attributes.background: An average of 2 women a week are killed in the UK. The majority are killed at home, often at the hands of a partner. One of the most dangerous times for a victim of domestic abuse is when they try to leave. In giving victims help with their economic situation, we could save so many.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside a threat of violence, emotional & financial barriers make leaving an abusive home difficult. Escaping requires meticulous planning and preparation. Someone may need time off work to move without their partner knowing or they may simply not be able to afford to escape. 

If the UK follows the example set by New Zealand and the Philippines, in giving domestic violence victims paid leave to escape their violent household, we could help before it's too late.

attributes.action: Stop NHS sharing data with 3rd-party advertisers, analytics and social media
attributes.background: When you use NHS websites, you get tracked. The issue was raised in 2010 by MPs, but was not resolved. Instead, Facebook and other companies went on to get data for a further 7 years. NHS privacy policies say that there's tracking. Such 3rd parties should be barred from NHS websites and mobile apps.
attributes.additional_details: The combination of HTTP Referers, third party cookies and third party JavaScript, provide these parties with the ability to track users by their unique or user ids and identify pages visited. Furthermore, third party JavaScript allows them to change NHS page content as they see fit, access data on it or act as the user on pages. I've complained directly to the NHS, ICO and Ministers in the hope of getting this fixed, but it is still a serious problem.
